Short Description: An award-winning open-access publisher of internationally leading academic scholarship in the humanities.
Why it's useful for students: Provides free access to high-quality, peer-reviewed research articles in various humanities disciplines.

Short Description: A library of over 75,000 free eBooks, primarily older works for which U.S. copyright has expired.
Why it's useful for students: Offers a vast collection of classic literature and public domain books for free, accessible online or for download.

Short Description: High-quality, peer-reviewed, openly licensed college textbooks that are free online and low-cost in print.
Why it's useful for students: Provides free, high-quality textbooks for a wide range of college courses, reducing educational costs.

Short Description: Offers free resources for teachers, students, and parents searching for high-quality K-12 humanities education materials.
Why it's useful for students: Provides lesson plans, student activities, and reviewed websites for various humanities subjects.

Short Description: The free online history encyclopedia with fact-checked articles, images, videos, maps, timelines and more.

Short Description: Free online games and lesson plans for civics education.

Short Description: Free lessons and resources for teaching people's history in K-12 classrooms.

Short Description: Collection of free Philosophy courses from the world's leading universities.

Short Description: Provides free digital access to millions of materials from libraries, archives, and museums across the United States.

Short Description: Thousands of social studies activities, lessons, and interactive resources for all grades, aligned to state and national standards.

Title/Name: National Gallery of Art - Free Online Art Learning Resources
Short Description: Explore a selection of activities, lesson plans, and videos for educators and students for kids of all ages.

Short Description: Introductory and intermediate music theory lessons, exercises, ear trainers, and calculators.

Short Description: A free, exercise based approach to learning the fundamentals of drawing.

Short Description: Free, open source, cross-platform audio software for multi-track recording and editing.

Short Description: Free cross-platform digital audio workstation (DAW) that allows you to produce music with your computer.

Short Description: Free online music creation platform with a multi-track mix editor, loops, and samples.

Short Description: Online music and podcast studio for creating and collaborating.

Short Description: Millions of Smithsonian's images available for download, share, and reuse without asking.

Short Description: Over 492,000 images of public-domain artworks from The Metropolitan Museum of Art available for free and unrestricted use.

Short Description: Free online courses, lessons and practice in math, science, computing, history, art, economics, and more.

Short Description: Online courses from top universities and companies worldwide.
